pros: Don’t really know what to say.

job_title: Corporate QA Coordinator in McDonough, GA

cons: -The work/life balance in some positions isn't that great, but the company is very transparent with you from the beginning. -Some of management is great, some are the opposite.

pros: As a Regional manager I was given the opportunity to lead a dedicated collection staff, team supervisors and the donor recruitment team. We made a difference in the lives of many sickle cell patients and others that need blood for various reasons. I enjoyed top managements commitment to excellence. In particular how the company significantly increased the starting pay of our front line workers (phlebotomist) The support staff from our local marketing, human recourses and collection department were Excellent beyond measure. Great company to work for.
cons: In the hiring process it must be stated to all: If you are not willing to commit yourself to excellence everyday this is not the job for you. Attitude determines Altitude.

job_title: Resource Management Technician in Madison, AL
pros: Coworkers were fun. Felt like you were making a difference in the world.
cons: Swing shift isn’t conducive to family life

pros: there was none do not work here
cons: never know when you are getting off

review_title: Great mission, great co-workers, quick advancement.
pros: Lifesouth is a great place to develop professional skills and make decent money if you are an entry level employee. You can be promoted quickly if you are good at your job and show up to work. The company's mission and the actual job you do makes a difference.
cons: Short staffed 99% of the time. Work every holiday except Christmas and Thanksgiving. Bottleneck effect for promotions after a certain level.

job_title: Hospital Services Technician in Gainesville, FL
pros: The work isn't too difficult and is fairly easy to pick up
cons: Inconsistent schedule but it's not bad

job_title: Donor Services Specialist in Montgomery, AL
pros: Helping save lives in the community.
cons: The hours, management showing favoritism.

pros: raises annually for full time employees
cons: pay is not a lot son the beginning

job_title: Cord Blood Processor in Gainesville, FL
pros: Promote from within frequently. Willing to train on the job and value company experience, willing to overlook lack of degree Offer competitive pay
cons: High turnover rate. Policies change often to reflect changing field and advances in science, requires a level of critical thinking and passion for the work.

pros: The mission is great - saving lives by giving blood.
cons: If you like a toxic work environment where employees are treated like third class citizens by management, this is the place for you, especially if you like nepotism.

review_title: Good for experience, but a lot of work for the pay
pros: There are lots of opportunities for training and advancement. Most of the work is done independently.
cons: Pay was a bit low for the amount of work we had to do. We were almost always understaffed, and in the busier months we were swamped with work. Management tries to act like everything is fine and happy, yet you're left picking up the slack.

job_title: Cord Blood Processor in Gainesville, FL
pros: Good benefits Good environment Contribute for a greater good
cons: Long shifts Slighty below market pay

pros: Culture, co-workers, vision and mission, fulfilling work
cons: Low pay, little room for growth unless you are in operations

job_title: Donor Services Technician in Atlanta, GA
pros: I had a job that was the only pro. Also, my nearly two years at Lifesouth allowed me to land a much better job at a non-profit hospital with better pay and benefits off the bat.
cons:
Pay is awful. I did everything I could to maximize my pay (obtaining a CDL, Apheresis tech, etc) an it was still sub standard.

I work in Atlanta for nearly 2 years and it drained my soul. I never had schedules post more that 4-5 days before they started and usually it was 2 days before. As a result you have zero work/life balance.

You are forced to “bank” 40 hours of PTO before you can use any and you can’t touch that 40 hour even then. The only way to get that 40 hours is to stay with the company for 4 years and give two week notice before leaving. Zero sick leave.

Forced to work overtime every week.

Very rarely allowed to take a 30 mins lunch break you are promised in the interview. Forced to be available to work when on lunch.

review_title: Good cause  very poor management don't care about there people maybe only  the money
pros: What a great cause help save lives what could be better. Please give Blood you do make a difference
cons: Not sure if they care about the cause anymore they sure don't care about there people .they don't care what you think or your life just want more more more so sad will work you till you burn out and still want more

pros: I lived in city where company is located.
cons: Rampant nepotism and favoritism at this company. There is little appreciation for actual qualifications or job performance.

job_title: Clinical Laboratory Scientist II in Stone Mountain, GA

job_title: Clinical Laboratory Scientist in Stone Mountain, GA
pros: PTO when it gets approved for use (even if you have it)
cons: Previous upper management wasn't great but replaced with a Director who doesn't communicate and a messy Manager

pros: If you are just starting out this is a great place to work.

Its really hard to move up in the company.

pros: I loved my work family at LifeSouth. I have made lasting friendships over my years of employment. This company truly does make a difference in our local community.

Don't expect the best benefits or pay range. What they offer is competitive with other Non Profits.

cons: Hours are not stable. Pay is low.

review_title: They don't care about you as a person

review_title: Not a good place to work
pros: Competitive salary, new equipment and uniforms
cons: Company culture, Management. The company at its base level, the phlebotomy employees, are uneducated young people: no degrees. Rude, and uncooperative. They learn on the job and not test is required to pass phlebotomy. Schedule is all over the place, not fixed.

review_title: You are not supposed to have a life

They don't care if you have a life outside of work all they care about is you being here, they will call you to come in on your few days off and will even ask you to come back to work in the late hours just so they don't have to get out of bed and do it.

They dont actually care about their employees other than how much you work. Dont expect to take your 15min break either without a lot of backlash from higher ups and fellow co workers.

They will also force you to work over your already 10hr shift for more than 12 hours at times.

pros: Donors are nice and drives are fun
cons: Toxic at all levels of employment

job_title: Vice President of Finance in Gainesville, FL
pros: Work-Life Balance, Job Fulfillment: Make a Difference at Work and in Your Community, Great Co-workers
cons: So much to do / not enough hours in the day, but that is what makes tomorrow fun.

job_title: Community Development Coordinator in Atlanta, GA
pros: flexibility, autonomy, and stable hours
cons: management styles, egos, tech attitudes

job_title: Resource Management Tech/Trainer/Supervisor in Atlanta, GA
pros: Sometimes, we save lives. SOMETIMES.
cons:
In short: Everything.
Poor pay. (9-10$ for a highly technical and FDA regulated position? Seriously?)
Lack of employee rewards, benefits, or even recognition.
ZERO retention program (in 6 months, 90% of staff was turned over, including most of upper management)
Poor hours, and lack of regard for regular scheduling. 
Favoritism is RAMPANT. 
Raises are between 30 and 32 cents an hour, per YEAR. Whether you do a great job, or an average one.
Promotions are nearly non-existent, and when they are available, there's a good chance it won't be mentioned to you. That's right. You don't get promoted into an open position, if you've proven yourself. You have to ASK to be promoted. Promotion pay increase? 50 cents.

But really, the cover-all con is this: Each year, there are half a dozen or so meetings by staff, asking for suggestions on how to improve things. Complaints, criticisms, suggestions, ideas, etc. In my four year tenure, I did not see a single one get implemented. Not a single complaint addressed and corrected.

job_title: Components Laboratory Team Lead in Madison, AL
pros: Working here I learned a lot that enabled me to really advance my career in a good position within a good company.  I can't speak for all departments at LifeSouth, but in the Components Lab you learn things about records review, traceability and trackability, calibrating and maintaining lab equipment, and what is essentially a food safety standard housed in a medical type setting.  All of these skills are sought after and really are kind of invaluable to employers seeking candidates for quality control, quality assurance, or auditor positions.  The work at LifeSouth is not that good, but it's also not that bad.  The real upside to working there is the skills that you learn.  Think of working at LifeSouth as a stepping stone to a much better career.
cons: When I was employed there, the Components Lab was a well oiled machine that ran at a very high level of efficiency.   The other departments there were much less efficient.  Often, the inefficiency of the other departments would cost the Components Lab time, and in some cases, valuable resources.

pros: Helping the community and helping people. That's it.
cons:
They are constantly changing expectations. Telling you one thing during interviews and training, and then quadrupling expectations immediately. District Management does not show any support and gives nothing but negative feedback. Corporate Management comes in and yells at staff for hours and then goes to the next location to do the same. Evaluations are few and far between and management is told to always put something negative on employee evaluations. Our District Manager makes up her own discipline instead of using company guidelines. And has told people to shut up during open staff meetings.

Turnover is constant and is worse here than anywhere I have seen.

I'm sure there are worse places to work, but I would really have to look hard for one.

pros: This company wants to help save lives and could be great at it but it is  by people that don't have a clue how to manage people .
cons: Upper management treats its employees like they are slaves. Belittles them they call people out in front of others and disrespect people and some of managers act like they are better then  everyone under them .they have lost the reason the company started to help save lives . they need to work in the field and see what it's like.

review_title: Highly Inefficient Non-Profit Organization (13th Street Location)
pros: Pay is decent to good, compared to other jobs in the area requiring no experience. The work is extremely easy. Vacation days build quick, and yearly amount increases with time.
cons: Little room for advancement. Boring work environment. Most employees do not care about the life saving product they are handling. For a "health-conscious" company, vending machines have only soda and candy. You'll be hard pressed to find water and healthy snacks. Management does not care to hear your opinion on how to improve anything. "It's always been done this way" is the small-minded motto.

pros: They do on the job training so if you are not qualified you can still get the job. You can accumulate PTO fairly easily.
cons: Constantly lied to about bonus requirements. Every time we would meet a "goal" the stipulations would suddenly change. I never received any of the bonuses they boasted my entire year there. Also, this company does not care about its employees and views them as expendable. I wanted to go back to school part time and before I could even enroll they told me LifeSouth has a firm policy against working around school schedules. However, at least one other employee in the same branch was in school full-time and LifeSouth completed accommodated him. If you are literally two minutes late clocking in it is a strike against you. I thought this was a company about helping people and saving lives. I was truly disappointed when I found out it was about numbers and dollars.

job_title: Moblie Team Leader in Albertville, AL
pros: Very rewarding job!!! Loved the donors and knowing that I was saving lives everyday!!!
cons: Management is AWFUL!!!! Too much favoritism is shown!!  DRAMA, DRAMA, DRAMA!! It was like working with a bunch of high school kids and definitely cutthroat, with the manager in the middle of it all!! I have never worked somewhere where there was so much backstabbing and deceitfulness!!!  Nothing was ever done in a professional manner. The turnover rate within the last 6 months has been outrageous, with some of the best techs I have ever seen leaving because of the management and new people coming in being manipulated by the manager. You have some techs who would work their tails off and do their jobs VERY WELL get talked to and treated like dogs over new people that had absolutely no experience at all!!! It is sad to have to leave a job you love and look forward to going to and have donors that love you over some lying, backstabbing coworkers and a deceiving manager. This place will never change until he is gone!!!

review_title: Horrible corruption and nastiness amongst management
pros: Helping save lives is always a great thing to be doing even if it is for a horrible company that is deceiving the donors.
cons: Donors are deceived, quotas are inflated and reports manipulated. Donors are told the blood stays within the community but a lot is shipped out of the area and even out of the country depending on who will pay the highest price.  The company claims it's a local community non profit but everything is based on profit and blood seldom stays in the community.  Staff is treated horribly by management and threatened in a daily basis. If you care about people this is the wrong company to work for.

pros: The donors are amazing,being at a different location,not hard work, if keyword if people work as a team..
cons: Weekends were never rotated,center techs get to do whatever they want because they are derek's favorite's..everyone know's it but know one says anything...only a few people actually work and that's why the place has such a high turn over rate, they stay in emergency needs because of the unprofessionalism, everyone is scared to speak up and the 3 center techs are related and marshall's captain is best buds with the boss's favorite, so it is not about job performance it is about friends...cooperate should look a little deeper

pros: Pay was decent and co-workers were great.
cons: Upper management has terrible communication issues. They claim they follow the SOP but break the rules of it all the time. Mainly I had problems with the management.It seems like they try to be extra nice when they are trying to cover something up. I left because of management. My manager was unprofessional and thought he was funny but he really was offensive and hurt peoples feelings. Many people have left because of him but he is still in his position with no reprimand.  Manager did not appreciate the workers in my department and played favorites like crazy.

review_title: Worst company ever.  Employees that witness violations of proper blood safety are threatened by management to keep quite
pros: Working at a job where you save lives is one of the most incredible feelings. The idea of blood donation is a great one.
cons: The management is horrible. Constant threats to employees, cursing, ridiculing on a daily basis. No appreciation for donors or their health.  Employee morale is non existent. Employee training is very poor and typically self guided.

review_title: It's obvious some of these reviews are added to raise ratings.
job_title: Mobile Team Leader in Gainesville, GA
pros: You are out helping to save lives. A very noble profession. Helping out people in the community. There is no substitute for blood.
cons: No consistency in work hours. You get off of a late drive and then are expected back in, at times, for an early drive 4 to 6 hours later. No discernible family/life balance. Management with no medical background themselves will hire anybody with no experience. To management, the donors are numbers. Units. They don't see them as people who give anywhere from at least 45 minutes to upwards of close to two hours of their time to pad their already inflated pay checks.

review_title: DO NOT...I repeat DO NOT work for this god awful place
pros: You meet interesting people and it's not just a desk job
cons: No home life, no schdule, management is ridiculous and only care about filling a schedule. They don't care if you're sick, were in an accident, don't have childcare or have a sick child, they want you to work nonstop. You have no flexibility. The training is mediocre at best and they simply throw you into the fire and let you burn. If anything goes wrong, it's your fault. I wish I had never taken this job. I'm a hard worker but the this place is so dysfunctional it doesn't make sense. I would not recommend this place to anyone. If I could five them zero stars I would. They don't pay enough for the stress they put you under.

review_title: Not a very good place to work.
pros:
Flexible hours .
Mid managers and fellow staff members were pleasant to work for/with.
It really is hard to think of 20 positive words to say about Lifesouth community blood center.
cons:
Lots and lots of micromanaging. 
The interview process for an menial admin job was well over an hour. 
Kind of disgusting how much upper management / executives make considering it's a non-profit.
No room for advancement.

review_title: Facepaced! Loved the donors. Believed in the mission.
pros: The donors were amazing. They were the whole reason I got up and went to work everyday. The pay was ok for the work. Corporate, I thought, was strong and ethical.
cons: Too much drama! Like a soap opera! Everyone talked about everyone one else, including donors, and turns out corporate ONLY cared about numbers NOT the patients OR donors. I will not even give my blood there again, yet alone WORK there. Definitely a HUGE turn off for me. Very sad, too.

review_title: Management should be replaced and center will flourish!
job_title: Hospital Services Tech in Montgomery, AL
pros: Awesome for community, Ok health and saving plans for employees. Great place to get payed and halfway do your job!
cons: Managers and supervisors talk about one another yet smile in one another’s face! Most employees don’t do there jobs, take advantage of the time being payed! On cell phones or shopping on line when they should be working! Blood spilled and not cleaned up properly health issue that should be addressed!

pros: Having a gratifying job that helps save the lives of other people
cons: Management is AWFUL!!!! Too much favoritism shown!! Was NOT the job I was promised in my interview at all!! Work/Family ratio is non-existent. DRAMA, DRAMA, DRAMA!! It was like working with a bunch of high school kids and definitely cutthroat, with the manager in the middle of it all!! Schedules are horrible!! Be ready to work 5 or 6 weekends in a row, while other employees never work a weekend and the manager definitely doesn't work one. You work every holiday, so spending time with your family is out of the question! Nothing was ever done in a professional manner. Going to work was unbearable and I am so glad and fortunate to be gone.

pros:
The mission and work of LifeSouth very engaging.  We do important work that saves lives every day.  The work is varied and constantly changing, which keeps it interesting.  

Benefits like PTO are above average, and there are plenty of other programs for employees to take advantage of if desired (health improvement, HSA matching, 403b investment account).  Opportunities for career advancement are plentiful, allowing people can find their niche.

The company continues to adapt to the rapidly changing blood industry and is well positioned for continued success.
cons: Fast-paced and changing work environment isn't for everyone.

review_title: A Start For Entry Level Medical Prospects
job_title: Hospital Services Team Leader/Trainer in Gainesville, FL
pros: The learning and information that is given and accessible to you from very knowledgeable staff.
cons: There is a great disconnect from upper management to level staff to fix or address issues that need attention. The middle level management is not as informative and outspoken to upper management about having a dialogue or bridging the gaps of issues.

pros: Knowing that my hard work is the reason someone gets blood and can live another day.
cons: The management is absolutely horrible. They treat all of us like we're beneath them and even talk behind each others backs just to get ahead. Horrible tech hours and no work/life balance. Techs get blamed for things that the managers fall through on. They let us know at orientation that were disposable

pros: Fun, worthwhile work. You know that everyday you are saving a life.  You will learn a lot about business and yourself working here.
cons: High pressure, long hours, not conducive to family life. Low pay and expensive benefits. High turnover in management.

job_title: Donor Services Technician in Atlanta, GA
pros: The employees were great , great phlebotomy experience, the donors make your day easier , it has the potential to be a company you can gain stability and growth in
cons: No work life balance  , inconsistent schedules, people come and go, pay needs to be increased, HR very unpleasant, the 50 cents raises are a slap in the face honestly.

pros:
The workload was evenly balanced in proportion, you must have been prioritized coming in for simplicity's sake.
You did a variety of duties and found fulfilling lasting relations with coworkers and friends.
cons:
Sometimes the work was a little physically taxing, under time constraints. We were sometimes caught unawares as
to the instruction learning modules preparation. We needed a little more homework in terms of study guide material to
decipher from.

pros: decent pay, opportunity for plenty of overtime, plenty of PTO available, benefits decent, unused PTO paid out when you resign
cons:
They will wear their employees out!  Don't make any plans at the end of your shift, because you will likely not get off on time.  Unless you are a recruiter or manager,  Work-life balance is HORRIBLE.  Let me just reiterate 
H-O-R-R-I-B-L-E!

job_title: Donor Services Tech in Gainesville, FL
pros: You can move up quick. You may start out making $11 but within 3 months or so you could get a $2 an hour raise.
cons: No set schedule.  Buses leave out at all hoirs of thr day so u may have to be at work at 9am on Monday and 6am on Tuesday. Just depends. Family insurance is high but individual  is not bad.

review_title: There are better places to work.
pros: They do make sure you get breaks and a meal.
cons: Management is the worse, cutthroat environment, co-workers will do anything to try to get ahead. I was told the job was Monday thru Friday, but turned into every other weekend within a month. Everyone quit at the same time.

review_title: CEO is disconnected from Donor services.
job_title: Donor Services Specialist in Ocala, FL
pros:
Good time off structure on how you earn PTO. 
You are in the front lines of saving some ones life by working in This field.
cons:
Unfortunately the good ends there. Management will never praise your hard work. During review process you are scored low because they don’t feel anyone deserves over a 3.2 no matter how hard you work or how flexible you are. 
They give you plenty of PTO to earn. But when you try to use it they will make it very difficult for you to submit your request and once it is approved they will give horrible schedules upon your return for taking time off as a punishment. 
CEO has meeting with company staff but it’s not for your feedback it’s more of a bash session to tell you we are not good enough. Which destroys the morale company wide. Depending on the office you work out of it will be stressful to be successful. You are constantly being told your not good enough. You need to do better and are not looking to hear anything you wish to say. 
If your donors are not healthy, sick, don’t pass the physical it’s your fault some how you made them ill. At least that his how your managers will make you feel. 
If you have personal issues. Keep them to yourself. I have seen regional managers speak of another employees personal matters with other line level staff. Completely unprofessional 

I entered this field to give back. Do something good. Unfortunately this company will make him seem this is what they are about. They are not. It’s a non-profit that is only focused on profit.

review_title: High employee turnover for a reason
pros: I got to meet some really nice patients and made a few friends(who also left the company for good reason)
cons: The management is terrible they talk about all their employees badly behind their backs and are extremely disrespectful. They don't have enough equipment and most of the supervisors are unparalleled in their lack of care and compassion. They are dishonest and the benefits are disadvantages. They are always hiring because people are always leaving. There is no professionalism and the hardest workers do not matter at all to them they give you a quota and you don't have enough patients to get what you need. They make tons of promises but don't keep any of them are always looking to punish you if you get sick or hurt on the job and the phlebotomy team (which I was on) are also expected to be janitorial staff because they fired the janitorial staff. The equipment is unreliable buses are always breaking down. I along with 2 other coworkers had our bus break down 20 minutes from the office and were left waiting in the freezing rain and cold while oil and exhaust fumes leaked all over the bus for 2 hours after we called and then came to find out they new that bus was broken. We had to return to the center until they closed when we were supposed to be off by 2. I was literally told to sit there because there was nothing else to do and the 40 hours they promised me per week ended up being sometimes 25 hours per week which meant I could not accrue vacation or time off or get paid properly so I could pay my rent. Do not work there. Even after you leave other people who hire you do not want to accept lifesouth training because their standards are low and they wont do well in training you properly. Luckily I went to school and got certified and learned that the techniques they use are so far off. I had patients request me by name because they said others were rude incentive or just plain uncaring. It was a Hostile work environment and they deserve no respect for the way they treat the employees who truly care about their job their patients and their donors. I would like to have cared for the company but no one at the company cares about anything but their salary and when they can finally retire.

review_title: Great place to work, but needs a bit of work like any other company.
pros: They have great pay and benefits. Work with the same people frequently so you become a bit of a "family". Working for a good cause.
cons: It can be difficult to communicate with upper management. They hear what you say, but don't always act on it.

pros: I love working for this company. Knowing that blood is provided for patients in need is a great feeling.
cons: Not everyone wants to donate blood so you get told no often. Most jobs in the company deal with getting rejected so thick skin along with determination is needed.

review_title: Loved the Job, Despised the Company.
pros: Wonderful mission! Community Blood Centers allow you to go to work and touch lives every day which is a rare find anymore.
cons: Worst upper management I've ever encountered anywhere! Not a question of IF you will be fired, only a matter of time. Sad really but it is because the people at Corporate are really, really incompetent.

pros: Went to a different place everyday, met many interesting people, co-workers were  great . If I wee given the opportunity I work for this company again, until I retire.
cons: Too many hours, many times I knew what time I would be in, however, never knew what time i would get home..

job_title: Donor Support Technician in Decatur, AL
